item.title: Fixing Dyer Street
item.description: The removal of I-195 from the Jewelry District is supposed to help spur Providence’s second renaissance by providing ample green- and brown-field development sites for a whole host of biomedical companies apparently dying to move to a state and city in fiscal crisis whose current population does not have the required skills to serve as an employment base. Seriously, I am quite optimistic about the once-in-a-generation to develop a massive part of what should beÂ an integral part of Providence’s downtown core 1.
